intro: Microcos heterotricha, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Microcos heterotricha is often found in disturbed soils and can serve as an indicator of wetland environments.
